comments.body: IIRC twine -s signs them all, e.g. `$ twine -s *macosx*whl` only asks for the passphrase once.

I thought that also, but vaguely recall it not working. Probably need to test again. In any case, `wheel-uploader` doesn't do that and when I asked @matthew-brett  about it he said they could not get it to work.
Might be a function of the twine version. I didn't realize that pip did not automatically upgrade, so was running version 1.6.5.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +70,74 @@directory. Then upload the wheels. You will need to sign every file separately
in the process, keeping the pass phrase in the clipboard and pasting it in will
make that easier::

    $ cd ../terryfy

comments.body: It's not difficult, just not recommended to rewrite the public numpy repo.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +102,106 @@
We wait until this point to push the tag because it is very difficult to change
the tag after it has been pushed.

Reset the maintenance branch into a development state
